page.title: 13CONSERVATION IN DIPTFORD
page.content: The Devon Tree Bank is a campaign to help preserve {trees}. Diptford Primary School is helping the Diptford Tree Society with the upbringing of saplings, which are then planted in areas around the parish. The four seasons which for so long have been associated with agriculture are now reduced to two, with the loss of Spring and Autumn. Our area has a wet but reasonably warm climate which is influenced by Dartmoor.There are still ancient {footpaths }which provide receational walks. Many footpaths are disappearing because people today prefer to reach their destination by other means of transport. In Diptford we are concerned that our{environment} should remain unpolluted. Litter is a constant problem and every effort is made to educate people to take their litter home.Here the air is fresh.
